item.title: Report X-2023060621
item.description:
Report X-2023060621

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin and sent to Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Loose caps allowed liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents and carton causing the carton to rip. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2023060620
item.description:
Report X-2023060620

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was dropped during unloading. Once damage was discovered the pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin and sent to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: 2 x 4 L glass bottles shattered when dropped releasing all liquid contents wetting the contents and carton. No known cleanup material and no liquid in bin. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in line Hazmat bin

item.title: Report X-2023060599

Report X-2023060599

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: WILLINGTON

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023060599: SequenceEvent: Pkg arrived wet and was placed in a lined Hazmat bin with another leaking Hazmat pkg and sent to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Loose caps and failed seal allowed liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents and carton. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin with another leaking Hazmat pkg. 2. X-2023060600: SequenceEvent: Wet pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat Bin with another leaking Hazmat pkg and sent to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Loose caps allowed liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents and carton. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin another leaking Hazmat pkg.

item.title: Report X-2023060566
item.description:
Report X-2023060566

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was found to be leaking. Personnel used neutralizing powder on spill and placed pkg in lined Hazmat bin and relayed it to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: There is a 2" cut/gouge on the side corner near the bottom of 1 x 1 gal plastic bottle which caused the liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents and carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg and used neutralizer placed in separate lined Hazmat bins.

item.title: Report X-2023050542
item.description:
Report X-2023050542

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A used gasoline powered lawn mower was being returned with gasoline in its tank. A strong smell of gasoline prompted personnel to remove the pkg from system flow. Pkg was sent to QA where it was later taken to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: Spilled gasoline was found outside the fuel tank as well as several ounces of gasoline still in the fuel tank which leaked due to a loose gas cap. Released liquid appears to have been contained to the contents of and the inner packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed upright on an open cart as there is no way to secure it in a salvage drum/container.

item.title: Report X-2023050451
item.description:
Report X-2023050451

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Lawn mower with gas and oil still in the machine was shipped improperly. Pkg was transported in a manner that allowed it to leak due to no orientation arrows. Too much weight for the pkg caused the carton to rip as well. DescribePack: Gasoline leaked from the fuel cap and oil leaked from the crankcase through the carburetor wetting and contaminating the contents and carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg with contents sideways was placed on a rolling cart and staged by an open dock door until authorized and properly trained personnel could investigate, inspect and report the incident.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer and removed from workflow due to noxious odor. Package was brought to QA workstation and placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: All four of the plastic caps are loose, leaked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of flammable liquid.

DescribePack: Bottoms of 2 x 2 L plastic bottles are cracked which allowed liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents and carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed in an unlined unauthorized plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2023060646
item.description:
Report X-2023060646

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-27
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet package was unloaded from trailer and immediately removed from workflow. Package was placed in a plastic tote and left at a QA workstation for inspection. DescribePack: Glass bottle inner package is crushed, released virtually all of its contents. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023060644
item.description:
Report X-2023060644

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found with the top and side of the box wet. The package was put in a lined hazmat tote in the upright position and sent to QA. DescribePack: When the box was opened up and inspected it was found that 1 X 1 gallon bottle of formula 83 had leaked in the box. The seal under the cap was broken. The whole top of the box is wet from the leaking formula 83. The duration of release was about a minute. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The box was put in the upright position in a lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023060282
item.description:
Report X-2023060282

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was loaded improperly in a trailer causing damage to the pkg in transit. Upon arrival pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin and taken to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and reporting. DescribePack: There is a 1/4" crack on the bottom of the plastic bladder which allowed liquid to leak while in transit wetting at least one other pkg. Whereabouts of any other affected pkgs or clean up material is unknown. DurationRel: 14 and MitigateEffect: Leaking pkg was placed in lined Hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2023060211
item.description:
Report X-2023060211

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I was called to the unload for a leaking hazmat. The package was loaded on its side in the middle of a wall. I put the package inside a tote wearing googles and gloves. Brought package to QA to stop the leak/damage. Upon opening the package I found 1 of the gallon jugs had a loose cap and had leaked. DescribePack: Loose cap and being loaded on its side caused the damage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Upright the package stopped the leak.

item.title: Report X-2023051178
item.description:
Report X-2023051178

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was leaked on by another damaged package. When the box was found it was put into a lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: The box was leaked on by another damaged package. When the box was opened up and inspected it was found that 2 X 1 gallon bottles of the Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid had also leaked down the side and to the bottom of the box. The caps were removed, and it was found that the seal under the caps were broken. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The box when found was put in the upright position and put into a lined hazmat tote. The duration of release was less then 1 minute.

  • Description: OPENED PACKAGE TO INSPECT DUE TO THE BUBBLE MAILER BEING SUSPECTED TO CONTAIN A LIQUID OF SOME KIND. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X 4 OZ BOTTLE OF 6.1 TOXIC ETHANOL SHIELD FUEL STABILIZER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING TO INDICATE A REGULATED ITEM WAS BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CONNECTICUT USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 24390W, AMAZON MERCHANT FULFILLED NETWORK (MFN), 333 108TH AVE. NE, BELLEVUE WA 98004.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sr Admin Frankie brought to QA area from belt 1 ; pkg was wet and then identified as hazamat and brought to hazamat cage to contain and process. DescribePack: outside box was wet; upon opening - inside cap loose and seal under cap corroded DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: brought to QA then identified and immediately brought to hazmat cage where it was processed and put in yellow drum and sealed
